articles.name: How to Report an Unrecognized Charge on Your Discord Account
articles.title: How to Report an Unrecognized Charge on Your Discord Account
articles.body:
If you have a charge you do not recognize on your Discord account, we’re here to help. Please read through the rest of this Help Center article to ensure a thorough resolution.

Before you proceed, please refer to our Reporting Unauthorized Discord Transactions article for more information on how to accurately submit your support request.

What this article covers:

  • Steps to Take if Your Discord Account Has Unrecognized Charges
  • How to Report Unrecognized Charges that Appear on Your Discord Account
  • Additional Payment Details to Include in Your Support Request

Steps to Take if Your Discord Account Has Unrecognized Charges

First, check if the charge appears on any of your Discord accounts (including any alternate accounts) before contacting our support team about an unrecognized payment. This step ensures we can take appropriate account-level actions that match your situation.

If you can't find the charge on your Discord account(s), this may indicate that your payment method (credit card, PayPal, CashApp, etc.) was used without your permission.

Important: Please contact our billing team before filing a dispute with your bank. Filing a dispute or refund request directly with your bank for any Discord transactions may result in account suspension pending further investigation. For more information, please review our Chargeback FAQ.

How to Report Unrecognized Charges that Appear on Your Discord Account

To report unrecognized charges on your Discord account, follow the steps that match your situation:

Discord Account with Access to Email Address

If you've confirmed the unrecognized charges are from your Discord account and you have access to the email address associated with the account, follow these steps to report them:

1. Submit a ticket using our support form

2. Select "I do not recognize a charge on my Discord account" under the Type of Issue category

3. Select "Yes" when asked if you're using the email address linked to your Discord account

Discord Account without Access to Email Address

If you do not have access to the email address associated with your Discord account, please take the following steps:

1. Submit a ticket using our support form

2. Select "I do not recognize a charge on my Discord account" under the Type of Issue category

3. Select "No" when asked if you're using the email address linked to your Discord account

4. Select "No" again when asked if you can submit a ticket from your Discord account's email

Possible Hacked Account with Email Change

If you believe your Discord account has been hacked/compromised and someone has changed your email tied to the account:

1. Submit a ticket using our support form

2. Choose "Hacked Account" from the What can we help you with? drop-down menu

3. Enter your email address

4. Enter the username and email address originally associated with the Discord account before the account was compromised. (Please also include the UserID associated with the Discord account if possible)

5. Select the reason for how you believe the account was compromised from the dropdown menu

4. Select “Yes” when asked if your email associated with the Discord account was changed

This will forward your request to the team that is best equipped to help with account recovery.

Additional Payment Details to Include in Your Support Request

To help us resolve your case quickly, please provide:

  • Transaction date and amount
  • Payment method (credit card, PayPal, Cash App, Venmo, etc.)
  • Payment identifier (last 4 digits of credit card, PayPal invoice ID, $Cashtag, Venmo User ID, etc.)
  • Screenshots of the Discord charges on your bank statement
Any missing payment information may delay the resolution of your case.

Example of Submitting a Support Request

While we aim to resolve requests within 72 hours, some cases may take longer. To ensure the fastest possible response, please submit only one support ticket per issue—multiple tickets can delay our response time. For more information, see these resources:
  • Reporting Unauthorized Discord Transactions
  • Discord’s Refund Policy
  • Safe Ways to Shop on Discord
  • Chargebacks FAQ
These resources cover unrecognized transactions, refund policies, and safe shopping practices on Discord.

articles.name: How to Report Unrecognized Discord Charges Using ‘Other’
articles.title: How to Report Unrecognized Discord Charges Using ‘Other’
articles.body:
If you see a Discord charge on your bank statement that you do not recognize and are unsure which category it falls under (or if none of the options seem to apply), you can select "Other" when submitting your support request.

Before you proceed, please refer to our Reporting Unauthorized Discord Transactions article for more information on how to accurately submit your Support request.

Important: Please contact our billing team before filing a dispute with your bank. Filing a dispute or refund request directly with your bank for any Discord transactions may result in account suspension pending further investigation.
For more information, please review our Chargeback FAQ.
What this article covers:
  • How to Report an Unrecognized Charge Using ‘Other’
  • What to Include in Your Support Request

How to Report an Unrecognized Charge Using ‘Other’

When filling out the support form by choosing the “Other” category, please review the following:

If the charges are on your own Discord account:

First, review our Reporting Unauthorized Discord Transactions article to see if any situations match your case. If none apply, follow these steps: 

1. Use the "Other" form and select Yes when asked if the charges are on your Discord account. 

2. When asked if you're using the email linked to your Discord account to contact us:

  • Select Yes if you can still access that email address
  • Select No if you cannot access that email address
Important: If your Discord account was suspended and you would like to appeal the suspension, please also submit an appeal ticket through our Appeal form: https://dis.gd/report. 

3. If you're unsure which Discord account was charged, select "I am unsure the Discord account associated with the unauthorized charges." This helps us route your request to the appropriate support team.

Any refunds outside our standard refund policy may result in disabling your Discord account per our terms.

What to Include in Your Support Request

To help us resolve your case quickly, please provide:

  • Transaction date and amount
  • Payment method (credit card, PayPal, Cash App, Venmo, etc.)
  • Payment identifier (last 4 digits of credit card, PayPal invoice ID, $Cashtag, Venmo User ID, etc.)
  • Screenshots of the Discord charges on your bank statement
Any missing payment information may delay the resolution of your case.

Example of Submitting a Support Request

While we aim to resolve requests within 72 hours, some cases may take longer. To ensure the fastest possible response, please submit only one support ticket per issue—multiple tickets can delay our response time.
For more information, see these resources:
  • Reporting Unauthorized Discord Transactions
  • Discord’s Refund Policy
  • Safe Ways to Shop on Discord
  • Chargebacks FAQ

These resources cover unrecognized transactions, refund policies, and safe shopping practices on Discord.

articles.name: Discord Voice, Video, & Streaming Guide
articles.title: Discord Voice, Video, & Streaming Guide
articles.body:
Whether you're experiencing issues with voice, video, or streaming on Discord, this guide offers basic troubleshooting steps and links to additional resources for further support.

What this article covers:

  • Discord Voice Troubleshooting
    • Voice Troubleshooting Additional Resources
  • Discord Video Troubleshooting
    • Video Troubleshooting Additional Resources
  • Discord Streaming & Screen Share Troubleshooting
    • Streaming & Screen Share Additional Resources

Discord Voice Troubleshooting

If you're experiencing issues with voice chat on Discord, follow this step-by-step guide to help diagnose and resolve common problems.

1. Check Your Microphone and Headset

  • Ensure your microphone or headset is properly connected to your device.
  • If using a USB microphone, try plugging it into a different port.
  • Test your microphone with another app to confirm it’s working.

2. Verify Input and Output Devices in Discord

2a. To check your input devices through the desktop/browser app, tap on the cogwheel icon [] in the lower-left corner of the app to access your User Settings.

Cogwheel icon on Discord desktop/browser

2b. Tap on the Voice & Video tab. Make sure the correct Input Device and Output Device are selected. If you’re having trouble with your microphone not working while using the Discord app on desktop/browser, you can also run a Mic Test.

Example of the Input and Outside Device settings under the Voice & Video tab

2c. On the Discord mobile app, tap on your avatar in the bottom-right corner. Then tap on the cogwheel in the top-right corner to access User Settings.

2d. While under User Settings, scroll down and tap on Voice under App Settings. Here you can check your Input settings to ensure the correct Input Mode is selected (Voice Activity or Push to Talk).

Where to find Voice settings on mobile

2e. On the mobile app, you can adjust the Output volume and see if enabling or disabled additional settings helps.

3. Make sure you’re not Muted or Deafened

Double-check to ensure you haven’t accidentally muted or deafened yourself. You can check this on desktop/browser by looking to the right-hand side of your avatar in the bottom-left corner of the app.

Example of what it looks like when you are muted and deafened in Discord on the desktop app/browser

4. Check for any Discord app updates

Ensure you're using the latest version of the app, whether on desktop or mobile, to maintain compatibility and access the latest features.

Voice Troubleshooting Additional Resources

If you’re still running into issues with voice, here are some additional resources that can assist you with further troubleshooting and other features you can learn more about.

  • Krisp FAQ: Learn more about Krisp. How to enable it and use it while in a Discord Voice Channel.
  • Voice Regions on Discord FAQ: Learn how to set a Voice Region for a Voice Channel in Discord.
  • Mic Testing: Having trouble with your microphone in Discord? Try using Mic Testing to further troubleshoot your microphone and hear how you sound to others.
  • Discord Soundboard Guide: Using, Adding, and Managing Sounds: Learn how to use, upload, and manage Soundboard sounds.
  • How do I enable/disable Push-to-talk activation noise?: Learn how to set a sound for when you use Push-to-Talk in Discord.
  • Discord Voice and Video Troubleshooting Guide: A comprehensive troubleshooting guide for Voice and Video.
  • Voice Channels FAQs: Learn how to Voice Chat on Discord.

Discord Video Troubleshooting

If you're experiencing issues with sharing your video or viewing someone else's on Discord, this guide will help you get started with some troubleshooting steps.

1. Check Video device settings

1a. If your video is not displaying for others, the first thing you want to check is that the correct camera device is selected. 

Where to locate your camera settings under Voice & Video tab

1b. If the correct device is selected, please double-check the following:

  • Ensure your camera is properly connected to your device and try another port.
  • If using an external webcam, try unplugging and reconnecting it.

Test the camera in another application to confirm it’s working.

2. Check for any updates

Ensure you're using the latest version of the app, whether on desktop or mobile, to maintain compatibility and access the latest features.

If you have software installed for your webcam, check to make sure it doesn’t have any outstanding updates as well.

Video Troubleshooting Additional Resources

If you’re still running into issues with Discord video, here are some additional resources that can not only assist you with further troubleshooting, but also allow you to learn more about additional features.

  • Video Calls: Learn how to set up your camera for video calls
  • Video Backgrounds: Learn how to set and use a Video Background.
  • Video Upload Quality Settings on Mobile FAQ: Learn more about video upload settings on mobile.
  • Discord Voice and Video Troubleshooting Guide: A comprehensive troubleshooting guide for Voice and Video while using Discord.

Discord Streaming & Screen Share Troubleshooting

If you’re running into any issues with screen sharing or streaming, here are some settings to check.

1. Check your Internet Connection

  • Ensure you have a stable internet connection to prevent lag or disconnections.
  • If possible, use a wired connection for better stability.

2. Restart Discord and Your Device & Check for Updates

  • Close and reopen Discord to refresh the app.
  • If the issue persists, restart your computer or mobile device.
  • Make sure you’re also running the latest version of the Discord app.

3. Disable Hardware Acceleration

If you have Hardware Acceleration on, and you find your stream is lagging, please try disabling this setting to see if it helps. 

3a. Tap on the cogwheel icon [] in the lower-left corner of the app to access your User Settings in the desktop/browser app.

Cogwheel icon on Discord desktop/browser

3b. Press on Voice & Video then tap on the Video tab. While here, scroll down until you see the Hardware Acceleration setting. If enabled, tap on the check mark to disable. 

Example of where the Hardware Acceleration setting is located under the Voice & Video tab

4. Grant Necessary Permissions

Make sure that your desktop device has all of the necessary permissions to be able to screen share in Discord.

Windows:

  • Run Discord as an administrator by right-clicking the Discord icon and selecting Run as administrator.
  • Check Settings > Privacy > Screen Recording to ensure Discord has permission to record the screen.

macOS:

  • Go to System Preferences > Security & Privacy > Privacy.
  • Under Screen Recording, ensure Discord is checked.

Streaming & Screen Share Additional Resources

  • How to Screen Share on MacOS: Learn how to Screen Share through MacOS on Discord.
  • Go Live and Screen Share: Full guide on how to Screen Share and stream your favorite games to your friends.
  • [Mobile] Screenshare FAQ: Learn how to Screen Share through your mobile devices.
  • Game Overlay 101: Learn more about how to use Game Overlay while gaming and chatting with friends on Discord.
  • Streamer Mode 101: Learn more about using the setting Streamer Mode to ensure certain personal details aren’t viewed by others while you’re streaming.
  • Using Discord's OBS Streamkit Overlay: Learn how to install and use the OBS Streamkit Overlay.
  • Using Discord's XSplit Streamkit Overlay: Learn how to install and use the XSplit Streamkit Overlay.
  • Video Codec FAQ: Learn more about how to use Video Codec.
  • Mobile Voice Overlay (Android)
  • Clips: Learn how to capture, share, and edit Clips that you’ve taken while streaming.
  • Video & Screenshare Updates - Multistream and More!: Learn more about multi-streaming and other Video and Screen Share updates on Discord.
  • How to Screen Share and Go Live on Discord: Learn how to stream video on Discord and more!
Contact Us: If you’re still running into an issue with Voice, Video, or Streaming on Discord, you can reach out to Support team for further assistance: dis.gd/contact

articles.name: Discord Server Setup Guide
articles.title: Discord Server Setup Guide
label_names: how to set up a server
articles.body:
Setting up a Discord server is easy with this comprehensive guide. Whether you're building a community for gaming, study groups, or other hobbies, we'll walk you through the steps to create a server as well as share the different features and tools to manage it.

What this article covers:
  • What is a Discord Server?
  • Understanding Different Types of Servers
    • Friend Servers
    • Community Servers
  • Getting Started with Discord Servers
  • Understanding Key Features of Discord Servers
  • Tools for Discord Server Owners and Moderators
  • Advanced Server Setup Features

What is a Discord Server?

A Discord server is a customizable digital space where communities can gather, communicate, and share content. Think of servers as virtual meeting places that bring people together around shared interests, hobbies, or relationships. Each server is organized with different channels dedicated to specific purposes—whether that's text conversations, voice chats, or media sharing—making it easy to keep discussions organized and accessible.

Discord servers are free to create and can accommodate anywhere from a small group of friends to massive communities with thousands of members. They offer flexibility in organization, moderation tools, and customization options that make them suitable for virtually any type of group or community.

Understanding Different Types of Servers

Discord offers two main server types, each designed for different community needs and scales:

Friend Servers

Friend servers are private, invite-only spaces perfect for staying connected with your close friends or smaller groups. These servers provide an intimate environment where you can chat, share memories, coordinate activities, and maintain relationships with people you know personally. The smaller scale makes them ideal for casual conversations and personal connections.

Community Servers

Community servers are larger, invite-only spaces designed to bring together people from around the world who share common interests, hobbies, or goals. These servers focus on fostering learning, discussion, and connection within specific communities—whether that's gaming, art, technology, or countless other topics.

Community servers come with enhanced moderation tools to help manage larger groups effectively, including:

  • Server Insights: Analytics to understand your community's activity, growth patterns, and member engagement
  • Raid Protection: Advanced security features to protect against spam, bot attacks, and disruptive behavior
  • Rules and Onboarding: Structured systems to welcome new members, establish community guidelines, and create screening processes
  • Welcome Screen: Customizable introduction for new members
  • Server Discovery: Ability to be found in Discord's server discovery feature (if eligible)

These tools make Community servers well-suited for building thriving, organized communities that can scale while maintaining a positive environment for all members.

Want to learn more?

For a deeper dive into server types and their specific features, check out our comprehensive Clarifying Server Types article, which covers additional details and best practices for choosing the right server type for your community.

Getting Started with Discord Servers

Creating your first Discord server is a simple process that takes just a few minutes. Here's how to get started:

1. On the Discord desktop app or browser client, locate the Add a Server icon [] on the left sidebar of the app. 

2. Select either Create My Own or choose a template. 

3. If creating your own server, choose between:

  • For a club or community
  • For me and my friends

4. Name your server and add an optional server icon.

5. When you’re all set, press the Create button. 

Example of Creating a Discord Server on Desktop

Want to learn more?

You can learn more about creating servers or managing them in these detailed articles:

  • How do I create a server?

  • How do I delete a server?

  • Server Templates

Understanding Key Features of Discord Servers

Discord servers come with many powerful features available even without Server Boosting. Understanding these features will help you create a well-organized and engaging community space.

Server Channels

Channels are the foundation of server organization. You can create different types of channels to help organize conversations and activities:

  • Text Channels & Text Chat in Voice Channels: For text-based communication, file sharing, and ongoing discussions
  • Voice Channels: For voice and video communication, perfect for meetings, gaming, or casual hangouts
  • Forum Channels: Organized discussion spaces where you can create topic-specific posts without conversations overlapping (available only for Community servers)

Advanced Channel Features

To make the most of your server channels, consider these additional features:

  • Channel Categories: Group similar channels together for better organization
  • Drag and drop reordering: Easily reorganize channels and categories
  • Channel-specific permissions: Control who can access specific channels
  • Role-exclusive channels: Create private channels for specific member groups
  • Threads: Keep conversations organized within channels
  • Polls: Create polls for community decisions and feedback

Server Invites

Once your server is set up, you'll want to invite people to join. Discord provides several flexible ways to create and manage invites.

Info: You must be the server owner or have permissions to create and manage invites. 

Here are the different types of invites you can create:

  • Instant Invites: One-click links that bring people directly to your server
  • Custom Invite Links: Personalized invite URLs that are easier to remember
  • Temporary Invites: Links that expire after a set time or number of uses
  • Permanent Invites: Links that never expire (use with caution)
Want to learn more?

Learn more about managing invites: 

  • Invites 101

  • How do I invite friends to my server?

  • Custom Invite Link

  • Pause Invites FAQ

Tools for Discord Server Owners and Moderators

Effective server management requires understanding Discord's moderation tools and permission systems. These tools help you maintain a positive community environment while giving members appropriate levels of access and responsibility.

Essential moderation tools: 

  • Discord Roles and Permissions: The cornerstone of Discord server moderation, allowing you to create different member tiers with specific permissions
  • Members Page: Get an overview of your server members, their roles, and activity
  • Verification Levels: Control who can send messages and participate in your server
  • How to Prune: Remove inactive members to keep your member list current

Advanced Server Setup Features

For servers that grow beyond basic friend groups, Discord offers advanced features that help manage larger communities effectively. Many of these features become available through server boosting or by meeting Community server requirements.

  • Server Boosting: Discord's premium feature system that unlocks enhanced server capabilities.
  • Community Server Guidelines: For servers focused on building larger communities, enabling Community features provides additional moderation tools.
  • Server Member Application: Learn more about implementing applications to screen potential members before they join. 
For additional support, explore Discord's comprehensive Server Settings help center.

articles.name: Service and Purchase Disclosures
articles.title: Service and Purchase Disclosures
articles.body:
Information for Users in Japan

Overview: This page provides important information in accordance with Japan’s Specified Commercial Transactions Act. Discord is committed to transparency and helping users in Japan understand their rights and the terms of any purchases made through our service.

Service Provider Information: Discord Inc. is the company that provides the Discord service. Our CEO is Humam Sakhnini. We are headquartered at: 444 De Haro Street, Suite 200, San Francisco, CA 94107, United States. For help using the service, including for any purchases made, please visit us at support.discord.com

Fees and Charges: Discord offers a number of paid services, including:

  • Discord Nitro
  • Server Boosts
  • Digital enhancements such as profile effects, avatar decorations, and other cosmetic features

The price of each service is shown clearly before you make a purchase. Prices and currency may vary depending on your region and applicable taxes. 

Payment and Delivery: Accepted payment methods vary by region but typically include credit cards, PayPal, or app store purchases (such as Apple in-app purchases or Google Play store purchases).

For one-time purchases, payment is processed immediately. For subscriptions (such as Discord Nitro), payments are recurring and are charged at the beginning of each billing cycle. You can manage or cancel your subscription at any time from your user settings.

Once payment is successfully processed, the service is typically provided immediately. Subscriptions remain active until canceled by the user, and users will retain access to subscription benefits until the end of their then-current billing cycle.

Cancellation and Refund Policy: You may cancel a subscription at any time. Once canceled, your subscription will remain active until the end of the current billing cycle. Refunds are generally not issued after a purchase is completed, except where required by law or where eligible according to Discord’s Refund Policy. For more information or to request help with billing, please visit dis.gd/billing.

Software Operating Environment: To use Discord, you need a compatible device and internet connection. Supported systems include:

  • Windows 10 and newer
  • macOS 10.13 and newer
  • iOS 13 and above
  • Android 5 and above
  • Modern web browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)

More technical details can be found in our system requirements guide.

Additional Policies: To better understand how we handle your data and the terms of using our service, you may review the following documents:

  • Terms of Service
  • Paid Services Terms
  • Privacy Policy
  • Community Guidelines

articles.name: 1 Month of Discord Nitro for Customers of Select Elgato Products
articles.title: 1 Month of Discord Nitro for Customers of Select Elgato Products
articles.body:
Starting from June 26, 2025 (6:00AM PT) to June 26, 2026 (11:59PM PT), Elgato customers can claim 1 month of Discord Nitro from purchasing eligible Elgato products. Learn below about how you can claim Discord Nitro.

Promotion Summary

Offer Details: 1 month of Discord Nitro

Who is Eligible: Users who have had an active Nitro subscription or Nitro trial in the last 12 months are not eligible to redeem this Nitro promotion.

This promotion is not eligible in the following regions: Syria, Russia, Turkey, Iran, North Korea, Zaporizhzhia, Kherson, Donetsk, and Luhansk. 

We may add additional restrictions from time to time, if you receive an "Unknown Gift Code" error during the claim/redemption process, you are not eligible to redeem this promotion. You can learn more at this Help Center article.

Users who have had a Discord Nitro subscription at any point on their accounts and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic subscription in the past 12 months are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

If a user has had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting subscription active on their account and they’ve never had a Nitro subscription, redeeming this promotion will override that subscription.

We will not be able to refund any leftover subscription time from those, and the user will be forfeiting the remainder of the existing subscription when activating the 1 month Nitro trial.

Users who have already claimed a gift from this promotion are not eligible to claim further gifts from this promotion.

This promotion is not eligible in the following regions: Syria, Russia, Turkey, Iran, North Korea, Zaporizhzhia, Kherson, Donetsk, and Luhansk. If you receive an "Unknown Gift Code" error during the claim/redemption process, you are not eligible to redeem this promotion. You can learn more at this Help Center article.

Requirements: Claim the promo by purchasing eligible Elgato products starting June 26, 2025 (6:00AM PT), and redeem in your Discord account by July 26, 2026 (11:59PM PT).

Subscription: After the 1 month trial period, your Nitro subscription will convert to a monthly recurring subscription, and Discord will bill your payment method per month until you cancel it. You can cancel at any time in your Discord User Settings. 

What this article covers:
  • Promotion Summary
  • What is Discord Nitro?
  • What is Elgato?
  • How do I claim the Nitro Promo from my Elgato product?  
  • How do I redeem the Nitro Trial on my Discord Account? 
    • Eligibility for Redeeming the Nitro Trial
    • Step by Step Redeem Instructions
      • What if I am an Active Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting Subscriber? 
  • Frequently Asked Questions
    • Promotion Details
    • Eligibility for the Promotion
    • Payment Info and Subscription Questions
    • Potential Errors and Other Issues

What is Discord Nitro?

Discord Nitro is our Subscription plan that gives you access to special perks that’ll make your time on Discord as fun as ever! Personalize and enhance your experience with popular perks like HD streaming, 500MB file uploads, profile and avatar customizations, 2 free Server Boosts, and more:

  • Custom Emojis
  • Discord App Color Themes
  • Super Reactions
  • Avatar Decorations
  • Unique Server Profiles
  • Server Boosts
  • More Nitro & Nitro Basic perks

What is Elgato?

Elgato is a world leader in online audiovisual technology, empowering content creators and digital professionals to transform their ideas into immersive, impactful experiences. From award-winning cameras, microphones, and lighting to control surfaces, capture cards, and studio mounts, Elgato sets industry benchmarks that shape the status quo of digital storytelling. Backed by parent company CORSAIR (Nasdaq: CRSR), the brand leverages a strong global distribution network and consistent product innovation to deliver sustained growth. A trusted name in a rapidly expanding market, Elgato drives value for both creators and investors through its commitment to excellence and forward-thinking strategy.

Copyright © 2025 Corsair Memory, Inc. All rights reserved. CORSAIR and the sails logo are registered trademarks of CORSAIR in the United States and/or other countries. All other company and/or product names may be trade names, trademarks, and/or registered trademarks of the respective owners with which they are associated. Features, pricing, availability, and specifications are subject to change without notice.

How do I claim the Nitro Promo from my Elgato product?

Step 1 - Purchase and Add the Offer 

  • Purchase a qualifying product/SKU on Elgato.com and be sure to press "Add deal to Cart" when you see the Nitro offer during checkout.

Step 2 - Check Your Shipping Confirmation

  • Once your order ships, you'll receive an email from Elgato containing a redemption link. Select this redemption link to proceed to the next step. 

Step 3 - Redeem Your Code

  • Follow the instructions to redeem your Nitro Trial code within Discord and start enjoying your month of Nitro. 

How do I redeem the Nitro Trial on my Discord Account?

Once you have claimed the promo, you'll now need to officially redeem this promo on your Discord account. You must redeem this Nitro trial by July 26, 2026 (11:59PM PT).

Eligibility for Redeeming the Nitro Trial

This promotion is not eligible in the following regions: Syria, Russia, Turkey, Iran, North Korea, Zaporizhzhia, Kherson, Donetsk, and Luhansk. If you receive an "Unknown Gift Code" error during the claim/redemption process, you are not eligible to redeem this promotion. You can learn more at this Help Center article.

Users who have had an active Nitro subscription or Nitro trial in the last 12 months are not eligible to redeem this Nitro promotion.

Users who have had a Discord Nitro subscription at any point on their accounts and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic subscription in the past 12 months are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

If a user has had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting subscription active on their account and they’ve never had a Nitro subscription, redeeming this promotion will override that subscription.

Users who have already claimed a gift from this promotion are not eligible to claim further gifts from this promotion.

Step by Step Redeem Instructions

If you're eligible and ready to redeem this Nitro subscription on your own Discord account, you can follow these steps below to redeem the promo.

Info:
- Before redeeming Nitro, make sure you are logged in your own Discord account.
- If you accidentally redeemed the Nitro promo on an account that is not yours, we are unable to provide you with another promo.

Step 1 - Logging into Discord

  • If you're not already logged into Discord in your browser, you will then be automatically redirected to either:

Register for a New Account

If you don't have an account, you can directly register a new Discord account

Login to your Account

If you already have a Discord account, you can login to your account using your email and password or using QR code login

Create an account page

Login page

Step 2 - Claiming your promotion gift

Once you have logged into your Discord account, you'll see a new message asking you to confirm that you are accepting the Nitro subscription on the correct Discord account.

  • You'll see a notice saying: "You are accepting this gift as _________" 
  • If your Discord account does not have your payment information, you'll be asked to fill out your payment details. (Note: You will not be charged until the free trial ends and the subscription renews)
  • When you've filled out all the necessary information and you're ready to redeem this promotion, press the "Accept Gift" button. 
Info:

- If you're logged into the incorrect Discord account, press the "Wrong account" button to login to the other account.

Step 3 - Redeeming your promotion gift

1 Month of Nitro Gift

Review the details of the promotion then press on Next. Please note: if you switch to a different account at this step, you will not be able to claim and redeem the promotion on the account you switched to. 

Payment Details Review

Make sure your payment information is accurate. If your Discord account does not have your payment information, please fill out your payment details. You will not be charged until the trial ends and the subscription renews.

When you've filled out all the necessary information and you're ready to redeem this promotion, press the confirmation button.

Step 4 - Subscription Now Activated

  • After accepting the promo to your account, you'll now be automatically redirected to your Subscriptions tab in your User Settings to see your newly activated Nitro subscription on your account.

What if I am an Active Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting Subscriber? 

Just to clarify - if you have had a Discord Nitro subscription at any point on your account and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic subscription in the past 12 months, you are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

So long as you have had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting subscription active on your account and you’ve never had a Nitro subscription, you will be able to redeem this promotion and replace it with the 1 month Nitro subscription.

HOWEVER, please note: By choosing to activate this 1 month trial, you will lose any features associated with your current subscriptions, and **you will not receive a refund for any remaining value on your current subscription**.

At the end of the promotion period, you'll be converted to a paying Nitro subscription per month unless you cancel your subscription.

How do I share my Code with a Friend?

If you're unable to redeem the Nitro subscription link, you can share this link with a friend to use instead.

After you press on and open the promotion link, you can directly copy the promotion URL link in the new page and send it to a friend. We recommend sending the link in a private direct message. Make sure your friend redeems the code by July 26, 2026 (11:59PM PT).

Frequently Asked Questions

We know there's a lot of information to unpack on this promotion above, so we've also broken down this information in this FAQ section as well too.

  • Promotion Details
  • Eligibility for the Promotion
  • Payment Info and Subscription Questions
  • Potential Errors and Other Issues
    • Already Had/Have Nitro
    • Already Redeemed
    • Something's Wrong Here

Promotion Details

Q: How long does this promotion run for?

A: Elgato customers can purchase eligible Elgato products starting on June 26, 2025 (6:00AM PT) through June 26, 2026 (11:59PM PT). The 1-month Nitro promotion must be redeemed by July 26, 2026 (11:59PM PT). 

After July 26, 2026 (11:59PM PT), Elgato customers will no longer be able to claim a trial promo.

Q: How long does the Discord Nitro promotion last for?

A: You must redeem the Nitro promotion by July 26, 2026 (11:59PM PT).

If a code has not been redeemed to the Discord account by July 26, 2026 (11:59PM PT), it will expire and you will no longer be able to have 1 month of Discord Nitro.

Eligibility for the Promotion

Q: Who can claim this promotion from their Elgato purchase?

A: Eligible Elgato customers who purchase an eligible Elgato product can claim this promotion. Simply add a qualifying product/SKU to your cart on Elgato.com and press "Add deal to Cart" when you see the Nitro offer during checkout. Once your order ships, you'll receive an email with a redemption link that takes you directly to Discord to complete the process. Find more detailed redemption steps here.  

Q: Who can redeem this Nitro trial to their Discord account?

A: Users who have never had an active Nitro subscription on their Discord accounts are eligible to redeem this Nitro promotion.

Additionally, users who previously had a Discord Nitro subscription and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic subscription in the past 12 months are ineligible.

This promotion is not eligible in the following regions: Syria, Russia, Turkey, Iran, North Korea, Zaporizhzhia, Kherson, Donetsk, and Luhansk. If you receive an "Unknown Gift Code" error during the claim/redemption process, you are not eligible to redeem this promotion. You can learn more at this Help Center article.

Q: What if I'm a current or previous Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or a Server Boost subscription? Can I also take part in this promotion? 

A: If you previously had a Discord Nitro subscription at any point on your accounts and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic subscription in the past 12 months, you are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

If you have had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting subscription active on your account and you’ve never had a Nitro subscription,  you will be able to redeem this promotion and replace it with the 1 month Nitro subscription.

HOWEVER, please note: By choosing to activate this 1 month trial, you will lose any features associated with your current subscriptions, and **you will not receive a refund for any remaining value on your current subscription**.

At the end of the promotion period, you'll be converted to a paying Nitro subscription per month unless you cancel your subscription.

Payment Info and Subscription Questions

Q: Why do I need to submit my payment info to redeem Nitro?

A: Because Nitro is a subscription plan, at the end of your 1 month trial, we will start your first billing cycle so you can continue to enjoy Nitro on Discord.

However, you can cancel the Nitro subscription at any time before the end of the 1 month.

Q: Why do I see a temporary hold/charge on my account when this is supposed to be a free promotion?

A: Just to clarify, this Nitro promotion is free, however, there will be a temporary hold placed on the payment method upon activating the promotion. This is to help Discord confirm the payment method works as expected and to prevent the use of fraudulent payment methods. This charge will appear in your Discord transaction history, and it may appear as a hold on your payment method.

We immediately reverse the temporary hold, and you’ll see that reflected in your Discord transaction history. Your bank may take longer to remove the hold from your payment method.

Note: Banks will usually remove the temporary hold from your account within a few business days.

If your Discord transaction history does not show the hold released after 5 business days, please let us know at https://dis.gd/contact, and our support team will be able to investigate this issue further.

Potential Errors and Other Issues

Q: I see a "Oh no! It looks like you have Nitro already" error when I try to redeem my Nitro promo.

A: If you're seeing an "Oh no! It looks like you have Nitro already" error, that means that the Discord account you're trying to redeem this promotion on currently has a Nitro subscription so it is ineligible for this Nitro promotion.

Please make sure you're logged into the account that you want to redeem this promotion on.

Q: I see a "Sorry, looks like you’ve already had a Nitro sub!" error when I try to redeem my Nitro promo.

A: If you're seeing an “Sorry, looks like you’ve already had a Nitro sub” error, that means that you've previously subscribed to Nitro on your Discord account and you won't be able to redeem this 1 month perk.

If you have never subscribed to Nitro, please submit a ticket through our support system: https://dis.gd/contact and our support team will be able to investigate further.

Be sure to include your full Discord ID and email address tied to your Discord account.

Q: I see a "This gift has already been claimed" error when I try to claim my Nitro promo.

A: If you are seeing a "This gift has been claimed already" error, that means that the Nitro promo has already been used and cannot be used again. You may need to double check if you've claimed this promo on another Discord account.

Unfortunately, once the promo has been claimed, the promo cannot be re-enabled, and the Nitro cannot be transferred from one account to another.

Q: I see a "Wait a Second...Looks like this code didn't work." error when I try to redeem my Nitro promo.

A: If you're seeing an “Wait a Second...Looks like this code didn't work.” error, that means that the promo is invalid.

Please note that our support team is unable to intervene if you are given an invalid promo and we will not be able to provide a new promo.

Q: I see a “Looks like something went wrong” error when I click on “Next”.

A: There are several reasons why you may be seeing this error:

  • You are ineligible for this promotion
  • The promotion is invalid
  • The promotion has reached the maximum number of claims
  • The link is invalid

Please note that the Discord support team is not able to assist if you run into this error when attempting to redeem. See the list above for possible reasons why your account may be ineligible or otherwise unable to redeem this promotion.

Q: I see a "Sorry, This Payment Source Cannot Be Used for Redemption" error when trying to redeem my promo!

A: If you're seeing a "Sorry, This Payment Source Cannot Be Used for Redemption" error, that means that the payment method you've selected to cover the temporary $1 hold cannot be used for that purpose. 

Please keep in mind that prepaid payment methods, such as Gcash, cannot be used to cover temporary holds due to the nature of how prepaid payment methods function.

For more information on temporary holds, please check out this article!

Q: I see a “Looks like this promotion has reached its maximum number of claims” error when trying to redeem my promo!

A: If you are seeing a “Looks like this promotion has reached its maximum number of claims” error, that means the maximum limit for claims of this promotion has been reached and this promotion can no longer be claimed. If you have claimed this Nitro promotion, you are still able to redeem it to your Discord account!

Please note that the support team is unable to assist you if you run into this error and we are not able to increase the limit of claims.

Q: I see a “Looks like your email isn’t verified. Make sure to verify your email before claiming this gift.”

A: If you are seeing a “Looks like your email isn’t verified, make sure to verify your email before claiming this gift” error, you are trying to redeem this Nitro promotion on a Discord account with an email that hasn’t been verified yet.

You can check out this support article on how to resend the email verification for your Discord account. If you need help setting up your Discord account, you can read our Getting Started article. 

Q: What should I do if I'm experiencing issues with my Elgato purchase?

A: Contact Elgato's support team directly at https://help.elgato.com/hc/ for assistance with any purchase-related issues.

articles.name: How to Upgrade Your Nitro Subscription
articles.title: How to Upgrade Your Nitro Subscription
articles.body:
Discord Nitro gives you access to enhanced features and perks. If you're looking to upgrade your current subscription, here's how to do it.

What this article covers:

  • Upgrading Your Nitro Subscription
  • How to Upgrade Your Subscription
    • Desktop/Browser
    • Mobile
  • What Happens When You Upgrade?
  • Frequently Asked Questions

Upgrading Your Nitro Subscription

You can upgrade your subscription in two ways—either change the product type or subscription length:

  • Current Nitro Basic or Nitro Classic subscriptions can be upgraded to Nitro
  • Monthly subscriptions (Nitro Basic or Nitro) can be upgraded to yearly plans
Info: Nitro Classic subscribers can only upgrade to Nitro.

Important requirements for upgrading:

  • Your subscription must be active
  • You can upgrade from Nitro Basic to Nitro whenever you want
  • All upgrades take effect right away
  • Subscription upgrades during a billing period or payments under 50 cents may not qualify for proration. Instead, a new billing period will start with a discount for remaining time.

How to Upgrade Your Subscription

Desktop/Browser

1. Open the Discord desktop app or browser and navigate to your User Settings by selecting the cogwheel icon [] in the bottom-left corner. 

2. Select the Subscriptions tab and press Switch Plans in the subscription banner. 

3. Follow the prompts to upgrade your subscription. 

Upgrading Subscription on Desktop 

Mobile

1. In the Discord mobile app, tap your avatar in the bottom-right corner.

2. Tap the cogwheel [] in the upper-right corner to navigate to Settings > Manage Nitro. 

3. Tap the cogwheel [] in the upper-right corner to view your Nitro plan. 

Navigating to Your Nitro Plan on Mobile

3. In the subscription banner, tap Switch plans and follow the prompts to upgrade your subscription. 

Switch plans Button in Subscription Banner

What Happens When You Upgrade?

When you upgrade your subscription:

  • Your new benefits will be available immediately
  • You'll be charged the price difference prorated for the remaining time on your current subscription
  • Your next billing date will remain the same

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: What happens to my unused time when I upgrade?

A: When you upgrade, the remaining time on your current subscription will be prorated and applied as credit toward your new subscription.

Q: Can I switch between different types of Nitro subscriptions?

A: Yes, you can upgrade from Nitro Basic or Nitro Classic to Nitro. However, you cannot downgrade subscriptions - you'll need to wait until your current subscription ends to switch to a lower tier. 

Please note that if you upgrade or cancel your Nitro Classic subscription, you will not be able to re-subscribe to Classic.

Q: Why do I need to use the same payment method for upgrades as my subscription?

A: For security and billing consistency, your payment method for upgrades must match the one used for your recurring subscription.

Q: How can I use a different payment method for my upgrade?

A: To use a different payment method:

  1. First change your subscription's payment method
  2. Then proceed with the upgrade

Please note: The payment method you choose for the upgrade will become your new default payment method for future subscription payments.

Q: Will upgrading change my billing date?

A: No, upgrading your subscription will not change your billing date. Your next payment will still occur on the same day.

Q: What happens if I upgrade from a monthly to yearly subscription?

A: When upgrading from monthly to yearly, you'll be charged for the yearly plan minus the prorated credit from your remaining monthly subscription time.

Q: Will I lose my current benefits when upgrading?

A: No, you'll keep all your current benefits plus gain additional features from the upgraded tier.

Q: Can I upgrade from a monthly to an annual plan?

A: Yes, you can change your billing cycle when upgrading. Nitro annual plans offer a better value for your Discord experience!

Q: What payment methods are accepted?

A: Discord accepts credit/debit cards, PayPal, and various regional payment methods based on your location. Learn more about acceptable payment methods here.

Info:  Pricing varies by region. Please check the current rates in your location before upgrading. For details about localized pricing on Discord, press here. 

Q: How do I cancel my Nitro subscription?

A: You can cancel your Nitro subscription at any time through User Settings > Subscriptions on the device you initially made your purchase. After cancellation, you'll continue to have access to Nitro features until the end of your current billing period. Note that if you purchased through a third party (like the App Store or Google Play), you'll need to cancel through that platform instead. For detailed instructions, see our guide on canceling Nitro subscriptions.

articles.name: Extra Month of Nitro on Us - Summer 2025
articles.title: Extra Month of Nitro on Us - Summer 2025
articles.body:
It’s back! Double up on the magic with our new Nitro promotion valid from July 2, 2025 until July 15, 2025! Read below to learn more.

This promotion is gradually rolling out to users and will be available to all eligible users by July 8, 2025. If you don't see it yet, check back soon - it should appear in your app within the next few days. Make sure you're running the latest version of Discord to ensure you receive the update!
What this article covers:
  • Promotion Summary
  • What is Discord Nitro?
  • How do I claim my extra month of Nitro?
    • Step 1: Go to the Nitro tab
    • Step 2: Subscribe to Nitro Monthly
    • Step 3: Receive Your Month of Nitro
  • Frequently Asked Questions

Promotion Summary

Offer Details: Get 1 extra month of Discord Nitro when you subscribe to a Nitro Monthly subscription on Discord’s desktop or browser app.

  • Promotion also applies to eligible upgrades from Nitro Basic and Nitro Classic to Nitro Monthly.
  • You will receive your extra month of Nitro at the end of your first month.
Nitro Basic subscriptions and Nitro subscriptions through iOS (Apple) mobile are not eligible for this promotion.

Who is Eligible:

  • Discord users who have not had a Nitro subscription within the past 10 days.
  • Subscribers with Nitro Basic or Classic plans who upgrade to Nitro.
  • Users accessing Discord through the Android mobile app or mobile browser.
  • Users accessing Discord through the iOS mobile browser only (not on iOS Discord app). 
  • Users on the Discord desktop app or browser version.
  • Users with Nitro credits can redeem this offer on desktop, but not on mobile.

This promotion is not available for:

  • Yearly subscriptions are not eligible for this promotion—only monthly Nitro subscriptions qualify
  • Current Nitro members (including those with free trials or discounted plans)
  • Users who had an active Nitro subscription within the past 10 days
  • Sign-ups through the Discord iOS mobile app.
  • Nitro purchases that include Server Boosts on Android mobile

Requirements: This promotion is only available for purchases on our desktop and browser apps, and only available in certain regions. If you receive a "Sadly something went wrong here. You won't be able to use this code." error during the claim process, you are not eligible for this promotion.

Deadline for Claiming Promo: This promotion must be claimed before July 15, 2025 (12:00 AM PT).

What is Discord Nitro?

Discord Nitro is our subscription plan that unlocks a world of perks that’ll make your time on Discord as fun as ever! Personalize and enhance your experience with popular perks like HD streaming, 500MB file uploads, profile and avatar customizations, and more:

  • Custom Profiles
  • Custom Emojis
  • Discord App Color Themes
  • Custom App Icons
  • 2 Server Boosts
  • More Nitro & Nitro Basic perks

How do I claim my extra month of Nitro?

If you do not see the promotion within your Nitro tab after refreshing your app, this means that you are not eligible for this promotion.

Step 1: Go to the Nitro tab

Desktop/Browser

On the desktop or browser app, press the Direct Messages button in the top-left corner and then select the Nitro tab. Alternatively, you can navigate to your User Settings > Nitro.

Nitro Page on Desktop/Browser

Android

This promotion cannot be claimed through the Discord iOS mobile app. To receive this promotion if you're eligible, please log in through the Discord desktop app, browser client, iOS mobile browser, Android mobile app, or Android mobile browser.

On Android mobile, tap your avatar in the bottom-right corner, then the cogwheel icon [] in the upper-right corner to access Settings. From there, select Manage Nitro.  

Nitro Page on Android

Step 2: Subscribe to Nitro Monthly

This promotion applies only to monthly Nitro subscriptions, not yearly plans, on both Android and desktop/browser.

Desktop/Browser

Once you are on the Nitro page - simply press Claim Offer and select the monthly plan for Nitro.

On the next screen, enter your credit card information and other payment details.

Select Monthly Plan Window on Desktop

This promo will only allow users to receive 1 extra month of Nitro when subscribing to Nitro Monthly.

Android

Once you are on the Nitro page - simply press Claim Offer and select the monthly plan for Nitro.

On the next screen, enter your credit card information and other payment details.

Select Monthly Plan Window on Android

Step 3: Receive Your Month of Nitro

Upon successful completion of the payment, your account will be upgraded to Nitro!

Your additional month of Nitro will automatically be applied after the end of your first month.

  • On desktop, users can use their free month at any time (as a gift entitlement) 

  • On mobile, they automatically use the free month right away 

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: I don't see the promotion details on my Nitro tab. Why?

A: If you don't see any promotion details on your Nitro tab on the desktop or browser (this promotion is not available on the iOS on mobile), it is because you do not meet the eligibility criteria.

Q: If I upgrade my subscription from Nitro Basic or Nitro Classic to Nitro, can I receive this promotion?

A: Yes, this promotion applies for upgrades from Nitro Basic or Classic to Nitro.

Q: How much will I be charged if I upgrade my plan to Nitro?

A: We prorate the amount you'll be charged for upgrading to Nitro, which depends on:
1. Whether you're upgrading from Basic or Classic
2. The amount of your existing subscription plan you haven’t used
3. The remaining amount of your new subscription plan you will use after upgrading

For example, if you've used Nitro Basic for only 10 days this month, you'll only be charged for those 10 days at Basic's price. Then, if you upgrade to Nitro mid-month and have 20 days left, you'll only pay for those 20 days at Nitro's price, rather than for the entire month.

You can find more details here.

Q: I claimed and redeemed a different trial for Discord Nitro already. Can I access this promo?

A: Unfortunately, if you are currently on a free trial, discounted plan or have been in the last 10 days before attempting to claim, you are not eligible for this promotion. Have no fear, there will be more of these promotions down the road! 

Q: If I have Nitro credit in my account, can I apply it to this promo?

A: If you have credit in your account from a previous Nitro subscription, this credit will be automatically applied to the purchase total when you check out.

If you have credit in your account that is associated with a different Nitro subscription type (ex: Nitro Classic), it will not apply to this promotion.

Q: What happens if I'm currently using Nitro credit and claim this promotional offer? 

A: On desktop, Nitro credit users can purchase and claim this promotion. Here's how it works:

When you claim the offer while on Nitro credit, your paid subscription will begin immediately. Any remaining Nitro credit will be applied after your first paid month ends, followed by your extra free month, and then your regular subscription will continue.

Example: If you have 4 days of Nitro credit remaining when you claim the offer:

  • Your first paid month starts immediately
  • After 30 days, your remaining 4 days of Nitro credit activates
  • Once those 4 days end, your extra free month begins
  • After that, your regular monthly subscription resumes

This ensures you get the full value of both your Nitro credit and the promotion.

Q: I see a notification saying "You're ineligible for this offer". Why?

A: If you encounter this notification, it is because you do not meet the eligibility criteria outlined above.

Q: Will my subscription renew automatically after the promotion ends?

A: Yes your subscription will renew automatically after the promotion ends. If you’d like to make changes to your subscription, including cancel, you can find more information here. 

Q: Can I gift my month of Nitro to someone else?

A: No, this month of Nitro is yours to keep and will be automatically applied to your account. It can’t be gifted or transferred to another user.

Q: I purchased a Nitro subscription during the promotion period, but I’d like to request a refund. What are the steps?

A: Before requesting a refund, please review our Refund Policy to ensure that your purchase is eligible for a refund.

If you’d like to proceed, please send in a ticket specifying that you’d like a refund for your Nitro purchase to our support team here: dis.gd/billing and our agents will be happy to assist you.

Please note that if your refund is issued, you will lose any promotional value or discounts associated with the purchase.

articles.name: App Tracking Transparency for iOS
articles.title: App Tracking Transparency for iOS
articles.body:
App Tracking Transparency is a privacy feature that gives iOS users control over how apps access and share their data. This guide explains what this permission is, why Discord uses it, and how it enhances your privacy while using the app.

What this article covers:
  • What is App Tracking Transparency for iOS?
  • Why Does Discord Need this Permission?
  • Your Privacy Choices
  • Frequently Asked Questions

What is App Tracking Transparency for iOS?

Info: App Tracking Transparency for iOS is currently an experiment limited to users in various regions. 

App Tracking Transparency is Apple's privacy framework that requires apps to obtain user consent before accessing device identifiers used for tracking. This helps users make informed choices about their privacy while using iOS apps.

Why Does Discord Need this Permission?

Discord uses tracking to enhance your experience with Quests and mobile features. When you allow tracking:

  • You'll receive more personalized Quests that match your interests
  • Discord can better support game developers and businesses that rely on ads for discovery
  • The platform can continue providing a high-quality, free service to users

Your Privacy Choices

When prompted about tracking, you have two options:

  • Allow: Discord can access your device identifier to provide personalized Quests and experiences
  • Ask App Not to Track: Discord will respect your choice and not access your device identifier

You can modify this choice at any time through your Privacy & Security settings or App settings in your iOS device’s Discord app settings. Whether you allow tracking or not, you'll still have full access to Discord's core features.

App Tracking Transparency Notification

Info: Discord remains committed to protecting your privacy. For more information about how we handle your data, please visit our Privacy Policy.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Does allowing tracking affect my Discord messaging experience?

A: No, your core Discord features including messaging, voice chat, and server participation remain fully functional regardless of your tracking choice.

Q: Can I change my tracking preferences later?

A: Yes, you can modify your tracking preferences at any time through your iOS device settings under Privacy & Security > Tracking.

Q: What exactly is a device identifier?

A: A device identifier is a unique code that helps identify your device. For iOS, this is known as the Identifier for Advertisers (IDFA) and is used to deliver personalized experiences and advertising.

Q: Will Discord sell my data if I allow tracking?

A: No, Discord does not sell your personal data. The tracking permission is used solely to enhance your in-app experience and provide relevant Quests and features.

Q: How does tracking improve my Quests experience?

A: Tracking helps Discord understand your interests and activity patterns, allowing it to suggest Quests that are more likely to appeal to you and match your gaming preferences.

Q: Is my personal information safe if I allow tracking?

A: Yes, Discord maintains strict security measures and follows privacy regulations to protect your personal information, regardless of your tracking preferences.

articles.name: Discord Login & Email Troubleshooting Guide
articles.title: Discord Login & Email Troubleshooting Guide
articles.body:
What this article covers:
  • Invalid Email Error Message
  • Email is Already Registered
  • Email Does Not Exist
  • Changing Email Too Fast
  • Forgot Email
  • Lost Access to Email

Invalid Email Error Message

Example of the error message Invalid Email

If you see an Invalid Email error when trying to add an email address to your Discord account, we recommend waiting 24 hours before attempting to use the same email again.

Contact Us: If the error persists after 24 hours and you don’t have an alternative email address to try, our support team is happy to help! Please reach out to our Support team: http://dis.gd/contact 

Email is Already Registered

Example of the Email is already registered error message

If you receive the error message Email is already registered when trying to change the email address on your account, this is because the email address you are entering is already tied to a Discord account. Please try another email address.

Contact Us: If the email address is not tied to a Discord account, please reach out to our Support team: http://dis.gd/contact 

Email Does Not Exist

Example of the Email does not exist error message

If you are trying to log into your Discord account, but you’re getting the error message Email does not exist, this is because the email address you are entering is not tied to a Discord account. If you’re unsure what email address your account is tied to, please check out the Forgot Email section. Our Support team is not able to tell you what account your email address is tied to.

Changing Email Too Fast

Example of the You are changing your e-email too fast. Try again later. error message

If you are trying to verify or change your email address, but you’re getting the error You are changing your e-mail too fast. Try again later, please wait 24 hours and then try verifying or changing again.

Contact Us: If you’re still getting the error message even after waiting 24 hours, please reach out to our Support team: http://dis.gd/contact 

Forgot Email

Info: Our Support team is not able to disclose to you what email address is tied to your account.

If you can’t remember the email address that is associated with your Discord account, there are a few steps that you can try to find this out. 

1. Check if you're logged into the Discord account on another device/browser. You can then see what your email address is by accessing the My Account tab via User Settings.

2. At the login page, type in the email address that you think might be associated with your Discord account and then press on Forgot your Password. If that email address is tied to an account, you should receive an email to reset your password.

3. Check the inboxes of all your email addresses and search for emails from Discord.

4. If your account also has a phone number tied to it, you can try logging in using the phone number through the login page instead. Once logged in, you can check the My Account tab under User Settings to see what email address is on the account.

Lost Access to Email

Info: Our Support team is not able to change the email address associated with your Discord account.

Unfortunately, if you’ve lost access to the email address that is tied to your Discord account, you’ll need to be able to access it to be able to change the email address. You can try reaching out to your email provider to see if you’re able to obtain temporary access to your account.

articles.name: Discord Error Message Guide
articles.title: Discord Error Message Guide
articles.body:
What this article covers:
  • What to do if you Encounter an Account Verification Error
  • Other Error Messages in Discord
    • Discord JavaScript Error
Info: Experiencing an app error? Please visit our Discord Status page to verify if it's an isolated issue or a system-wide occurrence

What to do if you Encounter an Account Verification Error

Your next steps after encountering a verification error will depend on the error type. The articles below may be able to help you further. 

  • Email Login/Sign Up Errors: Receiving an error message when trying to login or sign up for a Discord account? Check out this article on how to troubleshoot these most common errors.
  • How to Fix Phone Errors on Discord: If you’re trying to add a phone number to your Discord account and are receiving an error, please check out this article.
  • Lost Two-Factor Codes: Did you lose access to your 2FA codes? Check out this article to learn how to gain access back to your Discord account.
Contact Us: If you’re still having trouble with account verification in Discord, please reach out to the Support team for further assistance: dis.gd/contact 

Other Error Messages in Discord

Discord Server Errors

Invalid Invite Links: If you’re trying to accept a server invite or send one to a friend and you’re seeing an error message, this article will guide you through possible reasons.

Discord JavaScript Error

If you receive a JavaScript error message when trying to run Discord, try these steps to resolve this.

1. Delete both of your App Data folders for Discord. 

  • Press the Windows key + R and type %appdata%. Select the Discord folder and then delete it.
  • Press Windows key + R again, and then type %LocalAppData%. Select the Discord folder again, and also delete this one.

2. After deleting both App Data folders, reinstall Discord. 

Contact Us: If the error message continues, please reach out to our support team for further assistance: dis.gd/contact

articles.name: 1 Month of ExitLag Solo Plan for Discord Nitro Users Promo FAQ
articles.title: 1 Month of ExitLag Solo Plan for Discord Nitro Users Promo FAQ
articles.body:
Starting from June 3, 2025 (10:00AM PDT) to July 3, 2025 (11:59PM PDT), Discord Nitro subscribers can claim 1 month of ExitLag Solo Plan trial. Read more below about the promotion below.

Promotion Summary

Offer Details: 1 month of ExitLag Solo Plan for Discord Nitro subscriber

Who is Eligible: To claim through Discord, you must be a current Nitro subscriber. 

Info: This promotion is not eligible in the following regions: Syria, Russia, Turkey, Iran, North Korea, Zaporizhzhia, Kherson, Donetsk, and Luhansk.  

We may add additional restrictions from time to time, if you receive an "Unknown Gift Code" error during the claim/redemption process, you are not eligible to redeem this promotion. You can learn more at this Help Center article.

Requirements:

Claim through Discord Gift Inventory from June 3, 2025 (10:00AM PDT) to July 3, 2025 (11:59PM PDT), and redeem in your ExitLag account by June 3, 2026 (10:00AM PDT).

What this article covers:
  • Promotion Summary
  • What is Discord Nitro?
  • What is ExitLag? 
  • How do I claim the ExitLag Solo Plan trial in Discord? 
    • Eligibility for Claiming this Promotion in Discord
    • Step By Step Claim Instructions 
  • How do I redeem the ExitLag Solo Plan trial on my ExitLag Account? 
    • Eligibility for Redeeming the ExitLag Solo Plan Trial
  • How do I share my Code with a Friend?
  • Frequently Asked Questions
    • Promotion Details
    • Eligibility for the Promotion
    • Claiming and Redemption Process
    • Potential Errors and Other Issues

What is Discord Nitro?

Discord Nitro is our subscription plan that gives you access to special perks that’ll make your time on Discord as fun as ever! Personalize and enhance your experience with popular perks like HD streaming, 500MB file uploads, profile and avatar customizations, 2 free Server Boosts, and more:

  • Custom Emojis
  • Discord App Color Themes
  • Super Reactions
  • Avatar Decorations
  • Unique Server Profiles
  • Server Boosts
  • More Nitro & Nitro Basic perks

What is ExitLag?

ExitLag is an AI-powered technology designed to optimize internet connections for online gaming by reducing latency and minimizing ping. The platform uses real-time traffic analysis to route game data through the most efficient network paths, bypassing common connection issues that cause lag. Supporting thousands of popular games, ExitLag operates on a subscription model and offers a free trial period so users can experience its effectiveness before purchasing.

How do I claim the ExitLag Solo Plan trial in Discord?

As long as you're a Discord Nitro subscriber, you'll be able to claim the ExitLag Solo Plan trial code in the Gift Inventory from June 3, 2025 (10:00AM PDT) to July 3, 2025 (11:59PM PDT).

Eligibility for the Claiming this Promotion in Discord

In order to claim this code, you'll need to be an active subscriber to Discord Nitro, (and you can be either a monthly or yearly Nitro subscriber).

  • If you are an active Discord Nitro subscriber, the code must be claimed in the Gift Inventory by July 3, 2025 (11:59PM PDT).
    • Otherwise, the code will not be available to claim after July 3, 2025 (11:59PM PDT). 

Unfortunately, if you are a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting subscriber, you'll need to subscribe to Nitro in order to claim this promotion.

Step By Step Claim Instructions 

1) Log into Your Discord account and head to the Gift Inventory tab. 

If you’re subscribed to Discord Nitro, start by logging into your Discord account. 

You may notice a notification bar at the top of your browser/desktop app, and you can press the "Take me there" button in the notification bar to be redirected to your Gift Inventory. 

For both the desktop/browser app and mobile app, you can also directly head to your User Settings, and then select Gift Inventory.

“Take me there” Button in Notification Bar

2) Press the Claim button for the ExitLag Solo Plan trial Gift

Once you press Claim on the ExitLag Solo Plan trial Gift in the Gift Inventory and you'll then see a new pop-up with your 12 character code for this promotion.

If you want to redeem your code later, you can press the Maybe Later button, and then redeem the code before June 3, 2026 (10:00AM PDT).

ExitLag Solo Plan Trial in Gift Inventory

How do I redeem the ExitLag Solo Plan trial on my ExitLag Account?

Once you have claimed the code in the Gift Inventory, you'll now need to officially redeem this code on your ExitLag account (or share this code with a friend).

To redeem your ExitLag promo code received via Discord, follow these steps:

1. Open the official ExitLag promo page: https://www.exitlag.com/lp/discord.

2. Log in to your account, or create a new one if you don’t have one yet.
3. Once logged in, in your account dashboard, navigate to the Prepaid Codes section.
4. Enter your promo code and press Redeem.

Eligibility for Redeeming the ExitLag Solo Plan Trial

This promotional offer is valid exclusively for ExitLag users without an active subscription at the time of redemption.

Only one (1) redemption is permitted per user account throughout the duration of the promotion.

The promotional code cannot be used to extend or be combined with an existing paid subscription.

Contact Support:

For help with your ExitLag Solo Plan trial code, contact ExitLag support through live chat at www.exitlag.com or submit a ticket via your ExitLag account dashboard.

How do I share my Code with a Friend?

If you're unable to claim this code on your own ExitLag account, you'll be able to share this code with a friend to use instead.

To share the code, you can copy the 12-character code from the Gift Inventory (in your User Settings in the Discord app) and then share this code to a friend in a Direct Message.

Frequently Asked Questions

We know there's a lot of information to unpack on this promotion above, so we've also broken down this information in this FAQ section as well too.

  • Promotion Details
  • Eligibility for the Promotion
  • Claiming and Redemption Process
  • Potential Errors and Other Issues

Promotion Details

Q: How long does this promotion for Nitro subscribers run for?

A: This promotion runs from June 3, 2025 (10:00AM PDT) to July 3, 2025 (11:59PM PDT).

After July 3, 2025 (11:59PM PDT), Nitro subscribers will no longer be able to claim a trial code.

Q: How long does my ExitLag Solo Plan trial code last for in my Gift Inventory?

A: Once a code is claimed in the Gift Inventory in Discord, all ExitLag Solo Plan trial codes must be redeemed by June 3, 2026 (10:00AM PDT).

If a code has not been redeemed to your ExitLag account by June 3, 2026 (10:00AM PDT), it will expire and you will no longer be able to claim 1 month of ExitLag Solo Plan.

Eligibility for the Promotion

Q: Who can claim this promotion in the Discord Gift Inventory?

A: All current and new Nitro subscribers are eligible for this perk. 

This does not include Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boost-only subscribers.

Q: Who can redeem this ExitLag Solo Plan trial to their ExitLag account?

A: This promotional offer is valid exclusively for ExitLag users without an active subscription at the time of redemption.

Only one (1) redemption is permitted per user account throughout the duration of the promotion.

The promotional code cannot be used to extend or be combined with an existing paid subscription.

Q: Can I redeem the ExitLag promotion to my ExitLag account in my region? 

A: Yes, the promotion is valid for all regions except Syria, Russia, Turkey, Iran, North Korea, Zaporizhzhia, Kherson, Donetsk, and Luhansk.

You can redeem the offer from any other location as long as your account meets the eligibility requirements.

Claiming and Redemption Process

Q: On which Discord platforms can I claim this promotion?

A: You'll be able to claim the promo on the mobile, browser and desktop version of the Discord app. 

Potential Errors and Other Issues

Q: What if I don't see the ExitLag Solo Plan trial code in my Discord Gift Inventory? 

A: In order to claim this code, you'll need to be an active subscriber to Discord Nitro and you can be either a monthly or yearly Nitro subscriber.

Unfortunately, if you are a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting subscriber, you'll need to subscribe to Nitro in order to claim this promotion.

If you are an active Discord Nitro subscriber, make sure to refresh your Discord client to double check if an update was needed.

  • What if I'm still running into issues? 
    • If the refresh does not work, please submit a ticket through our support system at: https://dis.gd/contact and our support team will be able to investigate further.
    • Be sure to submit the ticket using the email address associated with your Discord account, and send us a screenshot of the following: 
      1. Your My Account tab
      2. Your Gift Inventory tab

Q: I'm having trouble redeeming this promotion to my ExitLag account. How do I contact ExitLag support? 

A: You can contact the ExitLag support team via live chat at www.exitlag.com, or by opening a ticket through your ExitLag account dashboard.

articles.name: Account Connections on Discord FAQ
articles.title: Account Connections on Discord FAQ
articles.body:
Learn how to link Spotify, Xbox, PlayStation and other popular apps to your Discord profile using Account Connections. Show off what you're playing, listening to, and enjoying with your communities in real-time. This guide covers everything you need to know about setting up and managing your connected accounts for a more personalized Discord experience.

What this article covers:
  • What are Account Connections?
  • How to Connect External Accounts to your Discord Account
    • Desktop/Browser
    • Mobile
  • How to Remove External Accounts from your Discord Account

What are Account Connections?

Account Connections allows you to connect your favorite external apps like Spotify, Xbox, and PlayStation directly to your Discord account. This integration displays your connected accounts on your Discord user profile, sharing what you're playing, listening to, and enjoying with your Discord communities.

User Profile with connected accounts

How to Connect External Accounts to your Discord Account

Desktop/Browser

1. Head into your User Settings by pressing the cogwheel [] icon.

Cogwheel icon

2. Press on the Connections tab. To view all available connections, select the View More [] icon.

Connections tab under User Settings

3. Press on any icon of the connection that you want to add. You will then be prompted to log into that connection.

All available connections

4. You’ll know you’ve successfully connected when you receive a Connected your [External Account] account to Discord message.

Confirmation window that your X account has been connected to Discord

Mobile

1. Tap your avatar icon in the bottom-right corner of the app to navigate to your profile. 

Avatar icon

2. Tap on the cogwheel [] icon in the top-right corner.

Cogwheel icon

3. Press on Connections and then press on Add in the top-right corner. To add your desired connection, tap on the icon.

All available connections

4. You’ll know you’ve successfully connected when you receive a Connected your [External Account] account to Discord message.

Confirmation window that your Spotify account has been connected to Discord

How to Remove External Accounts from your Discord Account

Info: Discord Support is not able to remove a connection for you. You will have to log into your Discord account to remove the connection.
