Be sure to include your full Discord ID and email address tied to your Discord account.

Q: I see a "This gift has already been claimed" error when I try to claim my Nitro promo.

A: If you are seeing a "This gift has been claimed already" error, that means that the Nitro promo has already been used and cannot be used again. You may need to double check if you've claimed this promo on another Discord account.

Unfortunately, once the promo has been claimed, the promo cannot be re-enabled, and the Nitro cannot be transferred from one account to another.

Q: I see a "Wait a Second...Looks like this code didn't work." error when I try to redeem my Nitro promo.

A: If you're seeing an “Wait a Second...Looks like this code didn't work.” error, that means that the promo is invalid.

Please note that our support team is unable to intervene if you are given an invalid promo and we will not be able to provide a new promo.

Q: I see a “Looks like something went wrong” error when I click on “Next”.

A: There are several reasons why you may be seeing this error:

  • You are ineligible for this promotion
  • The promotion is invalid
  • The promotion has reached the maximum number of claims
  • The link is invalid

Please note that the Discord support team is not able to assist if you run into this error when attempting to redeem. See the list above for possible reasons why your account may be ineligible or otherwise unable to redeem this promotion.

Q: I see a "Sorry, This Payment Source Cannot Be Used for Redemption" error when trying to redeem my promo!

A: If you're seeing a "Sorry, This Payment Source Cannot Be Used for Redemption" error, that means that the payment method you've selected to cover the temporary $1 hold cannot be used for that purpose. 

Please keep in mind that prepaid payment methods, such as Gcash, cannot be used to cover temporary holds due to the nature of how prepaid payment methods function.

For more information on temporary holds, please check out this article!

Q: I see a “Looks like this promotion has reached its maximum number of claims” error when trying to redeem my promo!

A: If you are seeing a “Looks like this promotion has reached its maximum number of claims” error, that means the maximum limit for claims of this promotion has been reached and this promotion can no longer be claimed. If you have claimed this Nitro promotion, you are still able to redeem it to your Discord account!

Please note that the support team is unable to assist you if you run into this error and we are not able to increase the limit of claims.

Q: I see a “Looks like your email isn’t verified. Make sure to verify your email before claiming this gift.”

A: If you are seeing a “Looks like your email isn’t verified, make sure to verify your email before claiming this gift” error, you are trying to redeem this Nitro promotion on a Discord account with an email that hasn’t been verified yet.

You can check out this support article on how to resend the email verification for your Discord account. If you need help setting up your Discord account, you can read our Getting Started article. 

Q: What should I do if I'm experiencing issues with my Corsair purchase?

A: Contact Corsair's support team directly at  https://help.corsair.com/hc/ for assistance with any purchase-related issues.

articles.name: Server Tags
articles.title: Server Tags
articles.body:
Represent your server with Server Tags - 4-character identifiers that members can display proudly on their profiles, anywhere.

What this article covers:
  • What are Server Tags?
  • How to Use Server Boosts for Server Tags as a Server Owner/Admin
  • How to Select or Customize Your Server Tag as a Server Owner/Admin
  • How to Set or Remove a Server Tag as a Server Member
    • Desktop/Browser
    • Mobile
  • Frequently Asked Questions

What are Server Tags?

Example of a Server Tag

A Server Tag allows members of a server to represent that server everywhere on Discord! A Server Tag is a custom, 4-character label paired with an icon. While not unique to each server, it lets members proudly display a shared identity on their Custom Profile. A server owner or admin can use 3 Server Boosts to unlock a Server Tag for their community. This additional perk is separate from Boost Levels, so your server doesn’t need to reach a specific Boost Level to access it.

How to Use Server Boosts to Unlock Server Tags as a Server Owner/Admin

The server owner or admin can use any available applied Server Boosts to unlock Server Tags.

1. With the correct server selected, navigate to the Server Boosts tab in the upper-left corner. Only server admins and owners can view this tab.

Example of Server Boosts tab in a server

2. In the upper-right, you’ll see how many Server Boosts are available and recent activity of Server Boosts. If you have 3 Server Boosts available, you can enable this perk right away.

Example of Available Server Boosts

3. To apply boosts to Server Tags, hover over the perk and press Enable Perk. A window will appear where you can configure your newly unlocked perk!

Enable Perk Server Tag

How to Select or Customize Your Server Tag as a Server Owner/Admin

Info: If you update the Server Tag for your server, server members will have to reapply the tag again for the change to take effect.

If a Server Tag is unlocked for your server, you can set or change your Server Tag.

1. Select your server’s name in the upper-left corner and then press Server Settings.

Server Settings option

2. Press Server Tag to access all available settings. Here you can edit the following:

  • Server Tag name (can use up to 4 characters that are alphanumeric and certain special characters)
  • Badge
  • Color 

Setting or customizing your server’s Server Tag

How to Set or Remove a Server Tag from your Profile as a Server Member

You can set or remove a Server Tag from your profile using desktop, browser, and mobile.

Desktop/Browser

1. Select the cogwheel [] next to your Discord username to access your User Settings.

2. Press Profiles or select Edit User Profile to customize your profile.

Profiles tab under User Settings

3. Scroll down until you see Server Tag. Here, you can see all available tags by pressing Select. Pick your favorite and your settings will be saved automatically.

Server Tag selection box on desktop/browser

4. To remove a tag,  press X next to the currently applied tag.

 X button located next to Server Tag on desktop/browser

Mobile

1. Tap on your avatar in the bottom-right corner of the app.

2. Press Edit Profile.

Example of where to find the Edit Profile option on mobile

3. Scroll down until you see Server Tags and select which one you’d like to apply. The settings will be applied automatically.

Currently set Server Tag under User Profile on mobile

How to Join a Server Through Server Tag

By viewing another user’s profile and tapping on their currently displayed Server Tag, you can view a Server's Profile. By viewing the Server Profile you can learn more about the server and also select Join Server to join. If a server has Server Member Applications, you can fill out an application to the server.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: How many characters can I use in a Server Tag?

A: Server Tags are non-unique, 4-character tags that can consist of alphanumerical characters and certain special characters.

Q: Do Server Tags need to be unique across Discord?

A: No, Server Tags don't have to be unique across the platform. Different servers can use the same tag, though the combination of the tag and icon will help distinguish your community.

Q: What happens to members' profiles if our server loses the Server Tag perk?

A: If your server loses the Server Tag perk due to insufficient boosts, the tag will no longer be available for members to wear on their profile. Any members who had the tag applied will have it automatically removed from their profiles.

Q: Can I change our Server Tag after it's been created?

A: Yes, server owners and admins can change the Server Tag at any time. However, when you update a Server Tag, members will need to manually reapply the new tag to their profiles.

Q: Can server members customize the color of the Server Tag on their profile?

A: No, the color of the Server Tag is set by the server owner/admin and remains consistent for all members who use it.

Q: How many Server Tags can a user display on their profile at once?

A: Users can display only one Server Tag on their profile at a time, even if they belong to multiple servers with tags.

Q: Can I restrict which members can use our Server Tag?

A: Currently, there's no way to restrict which members can use the Server Tag. Any member of your server can choose to display it on their profile.

Q: Do Server Tags appear in messages or just on profiles?

A: Server Tags that are applied to a user’s profile will appear next to their name everywhere on Discord. This includes in chat, member lists, and Direct Messages lists.

Q: Can I include emoji or special characters in a Server Tag?

A: Server Tags can consist of alphanumerical characters and certain special characters. Certain characters, spaces, and emojis are not supported at this time.

Q: Can my server have multiple Server Tags?

A: No, each server can only have one Server Tag at a time. If you want to change your server's tag, you'll need to update the existing one rather than creating additional tags. Remember that when you update your Server Tag, members will need to reapply the new tag to their profiles.

Q: Will other users be able to click on my Server Tag to join the server?

A: Yes, selecting a Server Tag will open the Server Profile for that server. If applications are enabled, they can apply to join the server from the server profile. 

Q: Can I use current Server Boosts on my server for Server Tags?

A: If you are a server admin or owner and you have 3 Server Boosts already available for your server to use, then you can enable Server Tags right away. If you don't have enough Server Boosts available, you may need to change your current Server Level or get more Boosts from your community.

Q: What happens if I edit or change my current Server Tag in my server? 

A: If you update the Server Tag for your server, server members will have to reapply the tag again for the change to take effect.

Q: Is there a rate limit for how many times I can change my server tag once it is set?

A: Yes, there is a rate limit for changing your server tag. You can change your server tag after a certain period of time.

Q: What are “additional perks” and how are they different from Levels?

A: Additional perks are new features you can unlock directly with Boosts, separate from your server's Boost Level. Currently, there are two available: Enhanced Role Styles (which add gradient and holographic effects to roles) and Server Tags (4-character identifiers members can display on their profiles across Discord). Unlike traditional server levels, these perks can be unlocked individually without reaching specific level thresholds.

Q: How much do the new Additional Perks cost?

A: Enhanced Role Styles and Server Tags each cost 3 Boosts. If you want both perks, you'll need 6 Boosts total (3 for each perk).

Q: Are Additional Perks replacing the current server level system?

A: No, this supplements the existing level system. All current server level perks (emoji slots, file upload limits, etc.) remain exactly the same. This new system simply gives you additional ways to use your Boosts for targeted perks without affecting your server's level progression.

Q: Do Additional Perks use separate Boosts from my server level?

A: Yes, Boosts used for Additional Perks are dedicated specifically to those perks and don't count toward your server's level progression. Similarly, Boosts allocated to your server level can't be used for Additional Perks. You'll need separate Boosts for each - so if you want Enhanced Role Styles, you need 3 Boosts just for that perk, plus whatever Boosts you want to maintain your current server level.

Q: What happens to my Additional Perks if my server loses Boosts?

A: Perks require ongoing Boost allocation to remain active. If your server drops below the required number of Boosts for a perk, that perk will be disabled. Enhanced Role Styles will revert to solid colors, and Server Tags will be removed from members' profiles. Server owners/admins can choose which perks to maintain if Boost counts drop.

Q: Why can't I unlock perks even though I have enough Boosts?

A: Make sure you're accessing the Server Boost tab (visible only to server owners/admins) and that your Boosts are "available" rather than already allocated to your server level. Only server members with admin permissions can unlock Additional Perks. You need to have enough unallocated Boosts to enable Additional Perks. 

Q: Can I move Boosts between levels and perks after I've allocated them?

A: Yes, server owners and admins can reallocate Boosts between server levels and Additional Perks through the Server Boosts tab. However, if you move Boosts away from a perk, that perk will be disabled until you allocate enough Boosts back to it.

Q: Are Additional Perks a one-time purchase, or do they require ongoing Boosts?

A: Each additional perk requires an ongoing allocation of its required Boosts to stay active, just like levels. If your server drops below the required number of Boosts, the perk will be disabled until the necessary Boosts are reallocated.

Q: Can I purchase and manage Additional Perks from both desktop and mobile?

A: Additional Perks can currently only be purchased and configured on desktop.

articles.name: Enhanced Role Styles
articles.title: Enhanced Role Styles
articles.body:
Make certain roles in your server shine with Enhanced Role Styles. Choose between eye-catching gradient or holographic designs that make important roles stand out more in your community.

What this article covers:
  • What are Enhanced Role Styles?
  • How to Use Server Boosts to Unlock Enhanced Role Styles as a Server Owner/Admin
  • Setting Enhanced Role Styles as a Server Owner/Admin
  • Frequently Asked Questions

What are Enhanced Role Styles?

Example of Holographic Enhanced Role Style

Enhanced Role Styles help to make certain roles stand out more in your server. You can choose between gradient or holographic. The Enhanced Role Styles perk can be added to a server by applying 3 Server Boosts as an owner or admin of the server. This additional perk is separate from Boost Levels, so your server doesn’t need to reach a specific Boost Level to access it.

How to Use Server Boosts to Unlock Enhanced Role Styles as a Server Owner/Admin

The server owner or admin can use any available applied Server Boosts to unlock Enhanced Role Styles.

1. With the correct server selected, select Server Boosts in the upper-left corner. Only server admins and owners can view this tab.

Example of Server Boosts tab in a server

2. In the upper-right, you’ll see how many Server Boosts you have available and the recent activity of Server Boosts. If you have 3 Server Boosts available, you can enable this perk right away.

Example of available Server Boosts 

3. To apply to Enhanced Role Styles, hover over the perk and press Enable Perk. A window will appear where you can configure your newly unlocked perk!

Enable Perk Enhanced Role Styles

Setting Enhanced Role Styles as a Server Owner/Admin

Info: Enhanced Role Styles can only be edited on desktop/browser, it’s not available on mobile.

1. Select your server’s name in the upper-left corner and then press Server Settings.

Server Settings option

2. Press Roles. You can edit a current role or create a new one. To edit a current one, hover over the right-hand side and press on the pencil icon []. 

Edit button

3. Under role styles, you can choose between the following:

  • Solid
  • Gradient
  • Holographic

4. If you choose to set a Gradient, you can pick two colors or pick from available options.

Example of the Gradient Role Color options

5. Press Save Changes once you’re finished!

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: If I set an Enhanced Role Style for a role, what happens to the role color when my server no longer has the available Server Boosts?

A:If your server loses the Enhanced Role Styles perk due to insufficient boosts, any roles using gradient or holographic styles will automatically revert to solid colors using the primary color from their enhanced style.

Q: Can I use Enhanced Role Styles for all roles in my server?

A: Yes! Once you've unlocked Enhanced Role Styles by applying 3 Server Boosts, you can apply gradient or holographic styles to as many roles as you want.

Q: How do Enhanced Role Styles appear on mobile devices?

A: Enhanced Role Styles are fully supported on all Discord platforms, including mobile. Members will see gradient and holographic roles on iOS and Android just as they appear on desktop/browser.

Q: Can I combine Enhanced Role Styles with other role features like role icons?

A: Absolutely! Enhanced Role Styles work alongside all other role features, including role icons, so you can create truly distinctive roles for your community.

Q: If I switch from gradient to holographic (or vice versa), will I need to spend additional boosts?

A: No. Once Enhanced Role Styles are unlocked for your server, you can freely switch between gradient and holographic styles for any role without using additional boosts.

Q: Do members need to have a specific Discord version to see Enhanced Role Styles?

A: Members will need a reasonably current version of Discord to see Enhanced Role Styles. Anyone using an outdated app version may only see the solid color version of the roles.

Q: How do Enhanced Role Styles appear in dark mode vs. light mode?

A: Enhanced Role Styles are designed to look great in both dark and light mode, with automatic adjustments to ensure visibility and aesthetic appeal in either theme.

Q: How can I disable the animation effect for Enhanced Role Styles?

A: Select the cogwheel [] next to your Discord username to access your User Settings, select the Accessibility tab, and then enable Enabled Reduced Motion.

Q: Can I add Enhanced Role Styles to a server I'm a member of?

A: If you're a server member who wants to enable Enhanced Role Styles for your server, you can Boost your server to ensure there are enough Boosts available for a perk like this. However, only server admins & owners can enable this perk and configure it for their server.

Enable Reduced Motion setting

Q: How can I use the current Server Boosts on my server for Server Tags instead?

A: As a server owner or admin, you can disable the currently applied boosts to a level. To do so, head to the Server Boosts tab and then press on Disable Perk. You’ll then receive a confirmation window press on Disable to confirm. You can use all available Server Boosts to unlock additional perks.

Q: What are “additional perks” and how are they different from Levels?

A: Additional perks are new features you can unlock directly with Boosts, separate from your server's Boost Level. Currently, there are two available: Enhanced Role Styles (which add gradient and holographic effects to roles) and Server Tags (4-character identifiers members can display on their profiles across Discord). Unlike traditional server levels, these perks can be unlocked individually without reaching specific level thresholds.

Q: How much do the new additional perks cost?

A: Enhanced Role Styles and Server Tags each cost 3 Boosts. If you want both perks, you'll need 6 Boosts total (3 for each perk).

Q: Are additional perks replacing the current server level system?

A: No, this supplements the existing level system. All current server level perks (emoji slots, file upload limits, etc.) remain exactly the same. This new system simply gives you additional ways to use your Boosts for targeted perks without affecting your server's level progression.

Q: Do additional perks use separate Boosts from my server level?

A: Yes, Boosts used for additional perks are dedicated specifically to those perks and don't count toward your server's level progression. Similarly, Boosts allocated to your server level can't be used for additional perks. You'll need separate Boosts for each - so if you want Enhanced Role Styles, you need 3 Boosts just for that perk, plus whatever Boosts you want to maintain your current server level.

Q: What happens to my additional perks if my server loses Boosts?

A: Perks require ongoing Boost allocation to remain active. If your server drops below the required number of Boosts for a perk, that perk will be disabled. Enhanced Role Styles will revert to solid colors, and Server Tags will be removed from members' profiles. Server owners/admins can choose which perks to maintain if Boost counts drop.

Q: Why can't I unlock perks even though I have enough Boosts?

A: Make sure you're accessing the Server Boost tab (visible only to server owners/admins) and that your Boosts are "available" rather than already allocated to your server level. Only server members with admin permissions can unlock additional perks. You need to have enough unallocated Boosts to enable additional perks. 

Q: Can I move Boosts between levels and perks after I've allocated them?

A: Yes, server owners and admins can reallocate Boosts between server levels and additional perks through the Server Boosts tab. However, if you move Boosts away from a perk, that perk will be disabled until you allocate enough Boosts back to it.

Q: Are additional perks a one-time purchase, or do they require ongoing Boosts?

A: Each additional perk requires an ongoing allocation of its required Boosts to stay active, just like levels. If your server drops below the required number of Boosts, the perk will be disabled until the necessary Boosts are reallocated.

Q: Can I purchase and manage additional perks from both desktop and mobile?

A: additional perks can currently only be purchased and configured on desktop.

articles.name: Discord Commands, Shortcuts, and Navigation Guide
articles.title: Discord Commands, Shortcuts, and Navigation Guide
articles.body:
Master Discord's powerful features with our quick reference covering essential keyboard shortcuts, chat commands, text formatting, and navigation tools. Whether you're a new user learning the basics or a power user looking to boost productivity, this guide will help you navigate Discord like a pro.

From basic message commands to advanced keyboard shortcuts, we'll walk you through everything you need to know about controlling and customizing your Discord experience. Learn how to format text, manage channels, navigate servers efficiently, and use Discord's accessibility features to their full potential!

What this article covers:
  • Essential Keyboard Shortcuts
    • General Navigation
    • Main Functions
    • Message Navigation
    • Server & Channel Navigation
    • Accessibility Navigation
    • Text Formatting
  • Custom Keybinds
  • Slash Commands
    • Using Slash Commands
  • Frequently Asked Questions

Essential Keyboard Shortcuts

Here are the most important keyboard shortcuts for Discord. For more details regarding keyboard shortcuts, see our macOS, Windows, and Keyboard Navigation FAQ.

NOTE: These keyboard shortcuts are only available for the browser and desktop version of the Discord app.

General Navigation

Action Windows Mac
Open User Settings Ctrl + , ⌘ + ,
Open Keyboard Shortcuts menu Ctrl + / ⌘ + /
Create or join a server Ctrl + Shift + N ⌘ + Shift + N
Navigate back Alt + ← Alt + ←

Main Functions

Action Windows Mac
Search within current channel Ctrl + F ⌘ + F
Search across all channels Ctrl + Shift + F ⌘ + Shift + F
Open emoji picker Ctrl + E ⌘ + E
Open GIF picker Ctrl + G ⌘ + G

Message Navigation

Action Windows Mac
Browse channel history Ctrl + Up/Down Arrow ⌘ + Up/Down Arrow
Edit your last message Shift + Up Arrow ⌥ + Up Arrow
Cancel message or mark channel as read Esc Esc
Move between channels Alt + Up/Down ⌥ + Up/Down

Server & Channel Navigation

Action Windows Mac
Quick switcher for channels/DMs Ctrl + K ⌘ + K
Mute/unmute microphone Ctrl + Shift + M ⌘ + Shift + M
Deafen/undeafen audio Ctrl + Shift + D ⌘ + Shift + D
Switch between servers Ctrl + Alt + Right/Left ⌘ +⌥ + Up/Down

Accessibility Navigation

Discord supports various accessibility features for keyboard navigation:

Action Windows Mac
Navigate interactive elements Tab Tab
Activate selected elements Enter/Space Return/Space
Navigate messages and menus Arrow keys Arrow keys
Toggle pins popout Ctrl + P ⌘ + P
Toggle mentions popout Ctrl + Alt + @ ⌘ + ⌥ + @
Toggle channel member list Ctrl + U ⌘ + U
Toggle emoji picker Ctrl + E ⌘ + E
Upload a file Ctrl + Shift + U ⌘ + ⇧ + U
Get help Ctrl + Shift + H ⌘ + ⇧ + H

Text Formatting

Action Windows Mac
Bold text Ctrl + B ⌘ + B
Italic text Ctrl + I ⌘ + I
Underline text Ctrl + U ⌘ + U
Start/stop inline code block Ctrl + Shift + M  
While Discord doesn't have built-in font commands, you can customize your message formatting using these markdown options here.

Custom Keybinds

NOTE: These custom keybinds are only available for the desktop version of the Discord app.

You can also customize your keybinds in Discord by following these steps:

1. Open User Settings by selecting the cogwheel icon [] to the right of your avatar.

Cogwheel Icon

1. Select the Keybinds tab and press the Add Keybind button.

2. From the Action dropdown menu, select Record Keybind and press your preferred key combination. You can enable or disable each keybind as needed.

Use the Add Keybind button and Record Keybind option to create custom shortcuts

For more details about custom keybinds, check out our Custom Keybinds Guide.

Slash Commands

Discord's slash commands are a powerful way to interact with apps directly in your chat. These commands start with a forward slash (/) and provide an interactive menu of available options.

Slash commands provide these key benefits:

  • Easy-to-use interface with auto-complete suggestions
  • Built-in command discovery
  • Standardized command format across all Discord apps
  • Enhanced security and permissions management

Using Slash Commands

NOTE: Slash commands only work when an app has been added to a server or your Discord account. Learn how to add apps here.
  1. Type "/" in the message box to see available commands
  2. Browse through the command list or start typing to filter
  3. Select a command and fill in any required parameters
  4. Press Enter to execute the command

For a comprehensive guide on using slash commands, including troubleshooting tips and best practices, check out the official Slash Commands FAQ.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: On what platforms can I use keyboard shortcuts?
A: Keyboard shortcuts can only be used on the browser and desktop version of Discord. 

Q: On what platforms can I use custom keybinds?
A: Custom keybinds can only be used on the desktop version of Discord. 

Q: What's the quickest way to access Discord's keyboard shortcuts?
A: Press Ctrl + / (Windows) or ⌘ + / (Mac) to open the Keyboard Shortcuts menu for a complete overview of available shortcuts.
Q: How do I search for specific messages in Discord?
A: You can search within the current channel using Ctrl + F (Windows) or ⌘ + F (Mac). To search across all channels, use Ctrl + Shift + F (Windows) or ⌘ + Shift + F (Mac).
Q: Can I customize Discord's keyboard shortcuts?
A: Yes, you can create custom keybinds through User Settings > Keybinds. This allows you to personalize shortcuts according to your preferences.

Q: How do I quickly switch between servers and channels?
A: Use Ctrl + K (Windows) or ⌘ + K (Mac) to open the quick switcher. For server navigation, use Ctrl + Alt + Right/Left (Windows) or ⌘ + ⌥ + Up/Down (Mac).
Q: What are slash commands and how do I use them?
A: Slash commands are interactive tools accessed by typing "/" in the chat. They provide easy access to app and bot commands. Simply type "/" to see available commands and follow the auto-complete suggestions.

Q: What slash commands can I use in a Discord voice chat?
A: You can use slash commands in Discord voice chats when an app has been added to your server or Discord account. Learn how to add apps here.
Q: How can I format my text in Discord messages?
A: Use keyboard shortcuts like Ctrl/⌘ + B (bold), Ctrl/⌘ + I (italic), and Ctrl/⌘ + U (underline). You can also use markdown syntax for additional formatting options.
Q: Are there accessibility features in Discord?
A: Yes, Discord offers comprehensive accessibility navigation using tab, arrow keys, and specific shortcuts for features like screen readers. 

These can be found in the Accessibility Navigation section of the guide. You can find more general information on our Accessibility features here.
Q: How do I manage my audio settings quickly?
A: Use Ctrl + Shift + M (Windows) or ⌘ + Shift + M (Mac) to mute/unmute your microphone, and Ctrl + Shift + D (Windows) or ⌘ + Shift + D (Mac) to deafen/undeafen audio.

articles.name: Touch Grass FAQ
articles.title: Touch Grass FAQ
articles.body:
From April 1, 2025 (9:00AM PDT) to April 7, 2025 (11:59PM PDT) play the new adventure by Discord and earn an avatar decoration. This avatar decoration will be yours until May 1, 2025 (12:00AM PDT).

What this article covers:
  • How to Play
  • Frequently Asked Questions

How to Play

NOTE: The game is only available to play on the desktop app and browser.

Option 1

1. Tap on the alert in the bottom-right corner and then press on the right arrow icon to access the game.

Example of the alert that will appear in the Discord app

2. Press on Play Game to start the game.

Example of where to locate The Last Meadow under your User Settings

Option 2

1. Open User Settings by pressing the cogwheel [] in the bottom-left corner and select The Last Meadow in the left sidebar. 

2. Tap on Play Game to start the game!

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: What clients is this game available on?

A: The game is only available on desktop app/browser. Unfortunately, the game cannot be played on the mobile version of the app.

Q: How long does the avatar decoration last? 

A: The avatar decoration is yours until May 1, 2025 (12:00AM PDT).

Q: How long will this game be available? 

A: The game will be available until April 7, 2025 (11:59PM PDT). After this time, the game will be removed and cannot be played in the app.

Q: Will my score be saved if I exit the game? 

A: Yes, when you go back to The Last Meadow tab in your User Settings, you can tap on the Continue Game option to continue your progress.

Example of where to tap to continue your game

articles.name: Discord Audio and Video Error Codes: Troubleshooting Guide
articles.title: Discord Audio and Video Error Codes: Troubleshooting Guide
articles.body:
Having trouble with Discord? Here's a comprehensive guide to common audio and video error codes and how to resolve them.

To learn more about troubleshooting audio and video issues on Discord, make sure to check out our Discord Voice and Video Troubleshooting Guide! 

What this article covers:

  • Streaming Issues
  • Audio Issues
  • Debug Logs
  • Quick Reference Error Table
  • Still Need Support?

Streaming Issues

Sound Sharing Issues (1001)

If your stream has no sound, this is likely because Discord couldn't capture audio from your application.

To fix this, try:

  • Allow Discord's soundshare permission when prompted - this is essential for capturing audio from your application during streaming.
    • When you start a stream, Discord will display a system-level permission request that needs to be approved to enable sound sharing functionality. Select “Grant Access”
    • Without this permission, your stream will continue but viewers won't be able to hear any audio from your streaming application

Noise Canceller Error (1002)

If Discord encounters an internal error with its background noise canceller:

  • Leave the voice channel or call and then rejoin to reset the connection
  • If the issue persists, try completely restarting Discord
    • Note: This means fully closing the application (not just minimizing it) and relaunching it!

Audio Input Rate Mismatch (1003)

This error occurs when Discord detects a significant difference in microphone input rate, often resulting in distorted audio (like "robot voice" or slow speech).

To resolve this issue, try:

  • Using separate devices for audio input and output (e.g., USB microphone + separate headphones)
  • Switching to a different microphone if available
  • Changing your audio output device
  • Leaving and rejoining the voice channel
This issue is most common with combined input/output devices like gaming headsets. Using separate devices for input and output typically resolves the problem.

Stream Start Failure (2001)

If your stream fails to start, try:

  • Restarting the stream by clicking the "Go Live" button again.
  • If the issue persists, try closing and reopening Discord before making another attempt to start your stream

Stream Quality Issues (2002-2007)

You might encounter these errors if you're experiencing:

  • Low frame rates while viewing or streaming
  • High packet loss while viewing or streaming
  • Poor network quality while streaming

Common solutions for viewing/streaming issues include:

  • Checking your network connection quality and speed
  • Reducing stream resolution or frame rate settings
  • Ensuring your hardware specifications (CPU, GPU, and RAM) meet the recommended requirements for your chosen stream quality settings and making adjustments accordingly

Video Decoder/Encoder Errors (2008-2009)

These errors typically occur when Discord encounters internal issues processing video streams.

To resolve these issues:

  • Enable hardware acceleration in Discord's Video settings
  • Make sure your graphics drivers are up to date by visiting your graphics card manufacturer's website and downloading the latest stable driver version for your specific graphics card model
  • If issues persist, try restarting Discord completely
    • Note: This means fully closing the application (not just minimizing it) and relaunching it!

Stream at Maximum Viewers (2010)

This error occurs when you try to join a stream that has already reached its maximum viewer capacity.

When you encounter this error:

  • You'll need to wait until other viewers leave the stream before you can join
  • Try joining again later when the viewer count has decreased

Video Streamer Timeout (2011 & 2014)

If your stream or camera fails to establish an initial connection:

  • Check your network connection stability
  • Ensure hardware acceleration is enabled in Discord's settings
  • Verify your system resources aren't overloaded

Video Viewer Timeout (2012 & 2015)

When attempting to view a stream, but you're unable to establish the initial connection:

  • Enable hardware acceleration in Discord's Video settings
  • Check your network connection
  • Try closing and reopening Discord if the issue persists

Camera Frame Rate Issues (2013)

This typically occurs when your device's hardware is struggling to process the video feed.

If your camera video is sending at an unusually low frame rate:

  • Enable hardware acceleration in Discord's Video settings
  • Check if your device meets the hardware requirements for video streaming

Audio Issues

No Audio Input Devices (3001)

If Discord can't detect your microphone, ensure that:

  • You have a microphone physically connected to your device, either through USB, audio jack, or wireless connection.
  • Make sure the microphone is securely plugged in and recognized by your operating system

Try the following steps for a Mic Test as well:

  • Head to the Voice & Video tab (in your User Settings)
  • Use the Mic Test feature to test your microphone by pressing the “Let’s Check” button
  • Listen to the playback of your voice to see if Discord is detecting your microphone

Silent Audio Input (3002)

If your microphone is connected but not picking up sound, try:

  • Checking your operating system's input volume settings in your system sound preferences or control panel to ensure the microphone input level is properly adjusted and not set too low
  • Verifying your microphone or headset isn't muted by checking both the physical mute switch on your device and the software mute settings in your operating system's audio controls
  • Use the Mic Test feature (in the Voice & Video tab of your User Settings) to test your microphone by pressing the “Let’s Check” button and listen to the playback of your voice to see if Discord is detecting your microphone

Screen Share OS Not Supported (3003)

This error occurs when you attempt to use screen sharing on an unsupported Android version.

If you encounter this error:

  • You'll need to upgrade your Android device to version 12 or later to use screen sharing functionality
  • This error is specific to Android devices - other platforms are not affected
To learn more about Discord’s OS/system requirements, visit this Help Center article for more information.

Debug Logs

Debug Log Upload Failure (4001)

If you're unable to upload debug logs, try:

  • Checking your network connection to ensure you have a stable internet connection with sufficient bandwidth
  • Attempting the upload again after waiting a few moments

Quick Reference Error Table

Use this table to quickly identify and resolve common Discord errors:

Error Code What's Happening? How to Fix It
1001 No sound in your stream Click "Allow" when Discord asks for sound sharing permission
1002 Noise canceller error Leave the call/voice channel and rejoin
1003 Audio input rate mismatch ("robot voice") Try switching to separate audio input/output devices
2001 Stream won't start Try starting your stream again
2002 Low frame rate while watching Check connection and enable hardware acceleration
2003 Packet loss while watching Check your network connection or try a different network
2004 Packet loss while streaming Lower your stream quality or check your network connection
2005 Low frame rate while streaming Reduce stream quality or check if your device meets requirements
2006 Poor streaming connection Test your internet speed and ensure stable connection
2007 Stream is reconnecting Check your network connection
2008 Video decoder error Try turning hardware acceleration on in video settings
2009 Video encoder error Try turning hardware acceleration on in video settings
2010 Stream is at maximum viewers Wait for viewers to leave before joining
2011 Video stream timeout (Streamer) Enable hardware acceleration, check network and system load
2012 Video stream timeout (Viewer) Enable hardware acceleration and check network
2013 Camera sending low frame rate Enable hardware acceleration in video settings
2014 Video stream timeout (Streamer) Enable hardware acceleration, check network and system load
2015 Video stream timeout (Viewer) Enable hardware acceleration and check network
3001 No microphone detected Connect a microphone to your device
3002 Microphone not picking up sound Check OS volume and device mute switches
3003 Screen sharing not supported Upgrade to Android 12 or later (Android only)
4001 Debug log upload failed Check connection and try uploading again
 
Most streaming issues (2001-2006) can be resolved by checking your network connection or lowering your stream quality settings.

Still Need Support?

If you continue experiencing issues after trying these solutions, contact Discord Support for additional assistance with all the following information:

  1. A clear description of your issue and the error code you see
  2. The device and OS version you’re using? (ex. ipadOS 13, iOS 13, iOS 16)
  3. The Discord app version you’re using (ex: Version 26.1)
  4. Which clients is this issue occurring on (ex: browser, mobile and/or desktop)?
  5. Screenshots of all your Voice & Video settings
  6. (If applicable) A list of input and output devices you’re using
To contact the Discord support team, send a request through: http://dis.gd/contact

articles.name: Server Profile
articles.title: Server Profile
articles.body:
Looking for how to customize your per-server profile? Please check out this Help Center article.

Your Discord Server Profile is the first impression of your server. Customizing it helps showcase what your server is all about—whether its gaming, learning, or socializing. A well-crafted profile attracts the right community members or can show what your friend group is all about. Let’s explore how to make yours stand out!

What this article covers:
  • What are Server Profiles?
  • How to Customize a Server Profile
    • Name
    • Icon
    • Banner
    • Traits
    • Description
    • Games
    • Private Profile

What are Server Profiles?

Server Profiles are customizable information cards that showcase the identity and community of both personal and community Discord servers. Whether it's a friend's private server or a larger community space, these profiles display key details like the server's name, description, icon, games, and unique traits. They help potential members understand what your server is about before joining and appear when users explore or discover servers across Discord.

Server admins and owners can customize their server's profile to highlight unique interests, set expectations for new members, and make their community more discoverable to like-minded individuals.

How to Customize a Server Profile

A Server Profile can only be customized on desktop/browser, however, can be viewed on the mobile app.

To customize your server profile, navigate to your Server Settings by selecting the dropdown arrow [] next to your server's name. You'll be taken directly to the Server Profile tab.

Navigating to your Server Profile

Here are the customization options available:

  • Name - Choose a clear, memorable identity for your server
  • Icon - Upload a distinctive symbol that represents your community
  • Banner - Pick a banner to add color to your server profile
  • Traits - Select tags that describe your server's focus and  promote discovery
  • Description - Write an engaging overview of your community
  • Games - List the games your community plays or discusses
  • Private Profile - Control who can view your server's details

Name

Your server's name is its identity- it's the first thing people see when they discover your community. Make it clear, memorable, and representative of what your server is about.

To update your server's name, look for the Name field at the top of the Server Profile page.

When you're finished, press Save Changes to confirm your updates.

Adding a Name to your Server Profile

Save Changes Button

Icon

Your server's icon is a visual representation of your community that appears in Discord's server list and search results. A custom icon helps your server stand out and makes it instantly recognizable.

To update your server's icon, press the Change Server Icon button or select the current icon in the Server Profile tab.

Press Save Changes to apply your updates.

Adding an Icon to your Server Profile

Save Changes Button

Banner

If your server is a discoverable server and you set a custom banner, that banner will be displayed instead.

A server banner is a large header color that appears at the top of your server profile. 

To update your server's banner in the Server Profile tab, select a color tile in the Banner section. 

Select Save Changes when you're done.

NOTE: The first banner color option in this menu that appears is based on your current Server Icon’s color. 

Adding a Banner to your Server Profile

Save Changes Button

Traits

Traits are descriptive tags that help categorize and identify your server's focus areas. These tags make it easier for potential members to find communities that match their interests.

To add or edit traits in the Server Profile tab, select a trait box and type your desired trait. You can also include an emoji by pressing the emoji icon [] in the trait box.

Remember to select Save Changes to apply your updates.

Adding Traits to your Server Profile

Save Changes Button

Description

Your server's description is a detailed explanation of your server’s personality and purpose. 

To add or edit your server's description in the Server Profile tab, locate the Description field and begin typing in the text box below. 

Press Save Changes to apply your updates.

Adding a Description to your Server Profile

Save Changes Button

Games

If your server is focused on gaming, you can specify which games your server plays or discusses. To add or edit games in the Server Profile tab, locate the Games section. You can either select games from the available options or search for specific games by typing in the game field.

You can also remove a game from the list by pressing the checkmark [] n the upper-right corner of the game.

Selecting Games to Add to your Server Profile

Checkmark Icon in the Upper-right Corner of a Game

Private Profile

The Private Profile option allows you to control the visibility of your server's profile. When enabled, your server's profile information will only be visible to members who have already joined the server.

This option is enabled by default, however, your profile content becomes viewable to users outside your server when you:
  • Enable server discovery
  • Enable server widget
  • Create an announcement channel
You can re-enable Private Profile through your Server Settings, except for servers currently in Discover. If you disable any of these features mentioned above, you will still have to manually enable Private Profile.

In the Server Profile tab, find and toggle the Private Profile switch to control visibility.

Toggling Private Profile
